# Major Scale in C# (Dorian Mode, Shape: G)

The Major scale is a fundamental musical entity consisting of seven notes and is the foundation of Western music harmony. It is constructed using a specific pattern of intervals between the notes. The Major scale in C# (C# Dorian mode, shape: G) is based on the note C# and follows the intervals: whole step, half step, whole step, whole step, whole step, half step, whole step.

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- D# (Major 2nd)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- F# (Perfect 4th)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- A# (Major 6th)
- B# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major scale in C# (Dorian mode, shape: G) is commonly used in various genres such as jazz, funk, and pop music. It has a bright and uplifting sound due to its major 3rd interval and Dorian mode tonality, which adds a touch of melancholy and sophistication to the overall musical flavor. This scale allows for both happy and soulful expressions in compositions.
